text: The Russo-Turkish War of 1877–1878 had its origins in a rise in nationalism in the Balkans as well as in the Russian Empire's goal of recovering territorial losses that it had suffered because of the Crimean War. Tsar Alexander II was fighting against the Ottoman Empire led by Abdul Hamid II . ==Related pages== * Constantinople Conference Category:History of Bulgaria Category:19th century in Romania Category:Wars involving Russia Category:1877 in Europe Category:1878 in Europe Category:19th century in the Ottoman Empire Category:19th-century conflicts
title: Russo-Turkish War (1877–1878)
